alert.note: Alert for Grand Isle (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 23 at 12:54PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Clinton, north central Essex and northern Grand Isle Counties through 200 PM EDT... At 1253 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Jericho to near Au Sable Forks. Movement was northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. Rainfall rates near one inch per hour. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Ponded roads or standing water in poor drainage areas will be possible. Locations impacted include... Beekmantown, Schuyler Falls, Chazy, Saranac, Mooers, Altona, Wilmington, Au Sable Forks, Champlain, Jericho, Dannemora, Peasleeville, Rouses Point, Jay In Essex County, Alburgh, Black Brook, West Chazy, Irona, Sciota and West Beekmantown. This includes Interstate 87 between mile markers 161 and 176. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
